title: 40 Best Mother Day Movies of All Time - Movies to Watch With Your Mom
body_text:
Mother's Day always seems like one of the hardest days of the year to prepare for. You definitely want everything to be perfect so you can show your mama mama some love for everything that she has done for you. From planning the best breakfast in bed that she's ever had to finding the present that she's been wanting for a while now, you definitely want to make the day special. However, if you're a little stuck, there's nothing better to do than just to make some popcorn, curl up under blankets, and pop in a movie that your entire family will love. Not only will she enjoy seeing some of these flicks, but it's a nice way to get everyone together for a little while, which mom will appreciate. So great ready for the ultimate movie marathon with these films featuring some of the most incredible moms on the planet.
Here are the best movies to watch on Mother's Day.
1. Mamma Mia
You and your mom can totally pretend to be in paradise thanks to Mamma Mia. The film, which follows a young girl as she tries to figure out which of her mom's exes is her real father, is one of the best Broadway to film adaptations ever created. With fun ABBA numbers that you definitely know from hearing your mom's records growing up, you'll both be totally obsessed with this movie.
2. The Blind Side
Family isn't just born, it's made. Whether you're celebrating with your actual mom or someone who you consider to be the mother figure in your life, this football film shows us that your family can be anyone that you're close to no matter if you're actually related to them or not.
3. The Princess Diaries
Mother's Day isn't only about your moms, but also your grandmothers as well. Show them some love while watching one of the most iconic grandmother-granddaughter duos of all time.
4. Cheaper by the Dozen
Not only will Cheaper by the Dozen make you grateful to not have 11 siblings (unless you actually do have them), but also have you realize how chaotic things can be without having mom around.
5. Bad Moms
Bad Moms honestly gives us one of the realest portrayals of mothers in the 21st century in a laugh out loud flick that you'll want to watch over and over again.
6. Blockers
You might not want to watch this film with your parents, but if your mom is anything like the ones in in this film, then you definitely have one of the best moms in the world.
7. Lady Bird
Even if you don't have the best relationship with your mother, this film shows you that they'll be there for you no matter what.
8. Crazy Rich Asians
Despite what it might seem, all the moms in Crazy Rich Asians do have the best intentions for their children. Whether or not you agree with them, you have to admit that they're all super fierce in their own way.
9. Raising Helen
This lovely movie follows Helen, the fun aunt of her nieces and nephews, who suddenly finds herself their guardian after the death of her sister. With 3 kids under her roof, Helen figures out what it takes to be a mom.
10. Mean Girls
If your mom isn't like a regular mom and she's a cool mom, then you know that this movie will be absolutely perfect for her!
11. Whip It
In the town of Bodeen, Texas, there's only so much to do before you've done it all already. However, when Bliss Cavendar discovers her love for roller derby, she has to find a way to hide her secret before her parents find out.
12. Where'd You Go, Bernadette?
In this crazy film, Bernadette suddenly disappears and her family tries to find her to bring her back home. Chances are, your mom already read the book, so why not watch the movie, too?
13. Book Club
If your mom is a part of a book club, then she can probably hardcore relate to some of this film. Not only is it laugh out loud fun, but your mom will absolutely love seeing some of her favorite actresses on the same screen together.
14. Stuck in Love
Not only is this the perfect movie to watch with your mother, but it's also a fit for the whole family. There is no doubt that you'll find a character to relate to and the film's message about finding love in different people around you will bring everyone to tears.
15. Dumplin'
If you and your mom are super into beauty pageants, then this movie is the right one for you. Also, who wouldn't want to see Jennifer Aniston walk around in a giant crown like the queen she is?
16. The Incredibles 2
While Mr. Incredible got to be the big superhero in The Incredibles, it's Elastigirl who finally gets her chance in the spotlight in this incredible sequel.
17. Second Act
When the assistant manager of a value store gets the chance of a lifetime to join a high powered job, she takes it even though she has to lie to her brand new co-workers.
18. Breaking In
Gabrielle Union stars as a scared mother who tries to protect her children when a random intruder comes into their home and attacks them.
19. My Big Fat Greek Wedding
If you have a big family, then this film will be SUPER relatable to you and your mom. She'll likely think back to when she was planning her wedding and that would be so much fun.
20. Brave
Hopefully, you've never turned your mom into a bear. Either way, you'll definitely love to watch this film with your whole family, especially if you have younger siblings who want to join in on movie night.
21. Mother’s Day
If you’ve watched Valentine’s Day and New Year’s Eve, then you should already have a taste of what this film is like. The film features an ensemble cast that includes Shay Mitchell, Jason Sudeikis and Julia Roberts. It follows a group of people in Atlanta, as they deal with their unique relationships with their mothers. The situations touch on everything from divorced moms to adoption.
22. Mr. Mom
You’ll catch a few laughs watching this movie starring Michael Keaton as Jack, a man who loses his job and becomes a stay-at-home dad, while his wife goes back to work. The film will make you appreciate all mom does, as it follows Jack trying to deal with the balancing act of raising children and maintaining a household, including chores. The movie has a really cute ending that’ll make you say, "Awww."
23. Room
This award-winning movie is based on a novel of the same name. It follows the close relationship between a mother and son who have been living in a cell for several years. The son, Jack, was born in captivity, so he knows nothing of the outside world. Somehow, they both make it out and the film follows Jack and his mother, as he adjusts and experiences the world for the first time.
24. The Parent Trap
The Parent Trap, starring Lindsay Lohan as twin sisters, who were separated at birth has some serious replay value. Both the twins somehow end up at summer camp, where they learn that they are actually biological sisters. One scene in the movie follows twin Hallie, as she meets her mother for the first time. What happens after that is a funny adventure that’ll make you literally, LOL. The movie is a remake of the 1961 original.
25. Bend It Like Beckham
Bend It Like Beckham is a family-friendly romantic comedy that follows two girls, Jess, who comes from a conservative family, and Jules, a player on the local women’s soccer team. The movie explores the girls love of the sport as they try to navigate their relationships with their families, especially their mothers who both disapprove of their lifestyles.
26. Monster-in-Law
Monster-in-Law is a comedy featuring Jennifer Lopez as a woman who just got married. Everything’s all good and fun, until she meets her mean mother-in-law, played by actress, Jane Fonda. Jane Fonda’s character Viola, will do anything to get rid of her new daughter. All her antics make this movie a good time for you and your mom.
27. Mom’s Night Out
This is one of those movies where literally anything bad that can happen, does happen. The movie follows a group of a moms who want a fun, stress-free night out, while their husbands stay home and take care of the kids. You can only guess the night becomes anything but stress-free.
28. Terms of Endearment
Why not start the evening off with a good cry? This 1983 classic, which swept the Oscars the following year, follows a mother and daughter (played by the impeccable Shirley MacLaine and Debra Winger) each finding their footing in love. Then one of them gets terminal cancer — and, well, that's why you'll be starting the evening off with a good cry.
P.S. It also stars Jack Nicholson. Always a good thing.
29. Steel Magnolias
Ready for some more crying? This time courtesy of Sally Field, Julia Roberts, and another terminal illness. The movie, which revolves around the women of a Louisiana beauty salon, is ultimately a story of strength and friendship. And it also stars Dolly Parton!
30. Akeelah and the Bee
Keke Palmer plays a spelling prodigy who overcomes a litany of obstacles to compete in the state championship, including the disapproval of her mother (played by Angela Bassett), a widow who is concerned for her daughter's well-being. Eventually they come to an understanding and the end is absolutely h-e-a-r-t-w-a-r-m-i-n-g.
31. Mermaids
Cher, Winona Ryder, and mini Christina Ricci bring this 1986 novel by Patty Dann to life, playing characters who might not make up a conventional family — Cher is a single mom who moves her kids around every time she breaks up with a man — but they sure make up a wonderful one. Consider this scene "set the table" goals.
32. Mommie Dearest
This is worth watching if you want to realize your mom isn't that bad after all. She let you use wire hangers, after all.
33. The Joy Luck Club
Based on the best-selling novel by Amy Tan, the movie follows a group of four women (i.e. The Joy Luck Club) who emigrated from China to America, and their daughters. The story shines a light on how the past shapes the present and how the experiences of your parents are intrinsically linked to your own.
34. Stella
Another tear-jerker, this one about a single mom who raises her daughter with a lot of love, and also around a lot of partying. By the end of the movie, Mom makes the ultimate sacrifice — and you're left in tears. (Yes, more tears. This is a theme.)
35. Freaky Friday
The classic life-swap story of a mother (Jamie Lee Curtis) and daughter (Lindsay Lohan) who each wakes up as the other — and they learn a lot about empathy in the process.
36. Crooklyn
Spike Lee's semi-autobiographical 1994 movie tells the story of a young girl, her four brothers, and their life in Bed Stuy, Brooklyn. At the head of the family is a tough but loving mother (played by Alfre Woodard). And guess what? She gets sick! Yes, this is another tearjerker. But worth the emotional turmoil.
37. Troop Beverly Hills
"We're the girls from Beverly Hills!" [1, 2, 3, 4.] "Shopping is our greatest thrill!" If this isn't already stuck in your head, it will be after watching this Shelley Long classic. She plays a rich, spoiled socialite whose divorce prompts her to become den mother to her daughter's troop of Wilderness Girls. The results are hilarious.
38. The Meddler
As the title suggests, this is about a nosy mom (Susan Sarandon) who meddles in the life of her struggling daughter (Rose Byrne). It's funny and warm and, shockingly, won't rip your heart out at the end.
39. Stepmom
This one, however, will rip your heart out. It also stars Susan Sarandon, this time as a dying mom of two who needs to come to terms with the fact that her ex-husband's new wife (Julia Roberts) will be in her children's lives long after she's gone.
40. Grey Gardens
Are you and your mom codependent? Consider this your cautionary tale!
Tamara Fuentes is the current entertainment editor at Cosmopolitan, where she covers TV, movies, books, celebrities, and more.
